description: A grid whose cells are regularly spaced in a geographic (i.e. lat/long) or map coordinate system defined in the SpatialReferencing System (SRS) so that any cell in the grid can be geolocated given its grid coordinates and the grid origin, cell spacing, and orientation.

$eref.description: Information about grid objects in the resource.

___resolution.description: The degree of detail in the grid.

___dimensionSize.description: The number of elements along the axis.

___dimensionType.description: The type of dimension for this axis.

___transformationParameterAvailable.description: An indication of whether or not parameters for transformation between image coordinates and geographic or map coordinates exist (are available).

___cellGeometry.description: Identification of grid data as point or cell.

___numberOfDimensions.description: The number of independent spatial-temporal axes.

___transformationDimensionMapping.description: Point in a pixel corresponding to the Earth location of the pixel.

___centerPoint.description: The earth location in the coordinate system defined by the Spatial Reference System and the grid coordinate of the cell halfway between opposite ends of the grid in the spatial dimensions.

___checkPointAvailable.description: Idication of whether or not geographic position points are available to test the accuracy of the georeferenced grid data.

___cornerPoints.description: The earth location in the coordinate system defined by the Spatial Reference System and the grid coordinate of the cells at opposite ends of grid coverage along two diagonals in the grid spatial dimensions. Note: There are four corner points in a georectified grid; at least two corner points along one diagonal are required. The first corner point corresponds to the origin of the grid.

___checkPointDescription.description: Description of geographic positions points used to test the accuracy of the georeferenced grid data.

___transformationDimensionDescription.description: Point in a pixel corresponding to the Earth location of the pixel.

___pointInPixel.description: Point in a pixel corresponding to the Earth location of the pixel.
